translated: In Sanskrit:

original: khar sa p'a ni s'a dha nam /
analyzed: khar sa p'a ni s'a dha nam /
translated: Karṣapaṇisādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: khar sa p'a ni'i sgrub pa'i thabs /
analyzed: khar sa p'a ni'i sgrub pa'i thabs /
translated: The Means of Accomplishing Karṣapaṇi

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: dang po re zhig sngags pas gdan bde ba la nye bar 'dug nas /
analyzed: dang po re zhig sngags pas gdan bde ba la nye bar 'dug nas /
translated: First, the mantrin, having sat on a comfortable seat,

original: rang gi snying gar aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: in his heart, from A, is a moon maṇḍala.

original: de la yi ge hr'i:mdog dkar ba bltas te /
analyzed: de la yi ge hr'i:mdog dkar ba bltas te /
translated: On that, he should visualize the syllable HRĪḤ, white in color.

original: de las byung bar gyur pa'i 'od kyis mdun du bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung bar gyur pa'i 'od kyis mdun du bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams blta bar bya'o //
translated: From that, light arises, and in front of him, he should see the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: de nas snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od kyis yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od kyis yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Then, with the light of the seed syllable in the heart, he should make offerings,

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: and having confessed his misdeeds and so forth,

original: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham zhes bya bas bdag nyid stong pa nyid du dmigs par bya ste /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a wa shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham zhes bya bas bdag nyid stong pa nyid du dmigs par bya ste /
translated: with OṂ SVABHĀVA ŚUDDHĀḤ SARVADHARMĀḤ SVABHĀVA ŚUDDHO ’HAṂ, he should visualize himself as emptiness.

original: sngon du bstan pa'i hr'i:yig las spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas spyan ras gzigs kyi bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du bstan pa'i hr'i:yig las spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas spyan ras gzigs kyi bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on Avalokiteśvara by the process of emanating and gathering from the letter HRĪḤ taught previously.

original: yan lag thams cad kyi mdog dkar ba /
analyzed: yan lag thams cad kyi mdog dkar ba /
translated: [The deity] is white in color, with all the limbs.

original: ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with a crown of hair.

original: 'od dpag med pa dbu la 'ching ba /
analyzed: 'od dpag med pa dbu la 'ching ba /
translated: Amitābha is bound on his head.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa phyag g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa g-yon pas padma 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa skyil krung phyed pas bzhugs pa phyag g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa g-yon pas padma 'dzin pa /
translated: He is seated in half-lotus posture, adorned with all the ornaments, bestowing gifts with the right hand, and holding a lotus with the left.

original: padma dang zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa'o //🔽g-yas kyi logs na sgrol ma dang nor bzangs gnyis so //
analyzed: padma dang zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa'o // g-yas kyi logs na sgrol ma dang nor bzangs gnyis so //
translated: He is seated on a lotus and moon seat.🔽On his right side are Tārā and Sudhana.

original: g-yon pa'i logs na khro gnyer can dang rta mgrin gnyis so //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i logs na khro gnyer can dang rta mgrin gnyis so //
translated: On his left side are Bhṛkuṭī and Hayagrīva.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi bor zla ba la aom /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi bor zla ba la aom /
translated: On the Bhagavān’s head, on a moon, is OṂ.

original: mgrin par a'a:snying gar h'um /
analyzed: mgrin par a'a:snying gar h'um /
translated: At his throat is ĀḤ. At his heart is HŪṂ.

original: de ltar bsgom pa go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa go bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand the meditation in this way.

original: rnal 'byor pa bsam gtan gyis ngal na bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa bsam gtan gyis ngal na bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: If the yogin is tired of concentration, he should do the recitation.

original: sngags 'di yin te /
analyzed: sngags 'di yin te /
translated: This is the mantra:

original: aom hr'i:sv'ah'a / khar sa p'a ni'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so //
analyzed: aom hr'i:sv'ah'a / khar sa p'a ni'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so //
translated: Oṃ hṛīḥ svāhā. The sādhana of Khasarpāṇa is complete.

original: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur ba'o//
translated: It was translated by the paṇḍita Amoghavajra and the Khampa translator-editor Gelong Bar.
